name: Rhizoctonia solani Positive Sample (Host: Amaranthus) SM6 Single
remarks: Single hyphal isolate (SM6) from infected stem
overview:
Rhizoctonia solani is a soilborne fungal pathogen responsible for various diseases, including root rot, damping-off, and sheath blight. It affects a broad host range, including cereals, vegetables, and ornamentals.
This isolate is available for pathogenicity studies and disease management research. It is recommended for studies on host-pathogen interactions, biocontrol strategies, and soilborne disease suppression.

types.as: Test tube slant 3 ml PDA + Grown culture from disc
Petriplate 15 ml PDA + Grown culture from disc

types.remarks: Sclerotia (20 Nos.) in sterile vial (1 Nos.)
